Remarks: Id by Dan Lane, giving the comment "S. macropus is not known to occur farthern north than southern San Martin, and is far more slowly-paced than this taxon. Birdingperu and Valqui's book have confused the issue regarding the distribution of macropus, unfortunately, so many people are reporting it from well north of where it actually occurs."

Response to playback of rolling vocalization (playback recording used made by Roger Ahlman, from same locality) by an unseen bird in treeline elfin forest. The fact that it is accompanied by an unseen S. l. intermedius giving 'typical' song suggests that this rolling vocalization may also be of that species, but this has not yet been confirmed. I have heard this voice at Cerro Huicsacunga farther north on the same slope, at similar elevations.

Remarks: Igarapé on left bank of rio Negro - igapó forest - fairly heavy bill, = head x 1 1/4, slightly decurved, with pale mandible and black maxilla - head black [dark?] turning buff on nape, streaked white - faint white eyebrow - otherwise russet brown - palish brown throat - below streaked buff through to middle of belly
